greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Transposed dispersion of A055938.
comment: This is dispersion array A254105 transposed. Please see there for a description.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..120; the first 15 antidiagonals of array
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: If row = 1, then A(row,col) = A005187(col), otherwise A(row,col) = A055938(A(row-1,col)).
example: The top left corner of the array:
program: (define (A254105bi row col) (if (= 1 col) (A005187 row) (A055938 (A254105bi row (- col 1)))))
xref: Row index: A254111, Column index of n: A254112.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 26 2015
